title: Anxiety Young People
content:
You might feel like you want to avoid a situation to make the feeling go away.
Sometimes anxiety can continue, even after whatever was making you anxious has passed or been resolved. Anxiety can also happen without there being a specific reason for it.
Experiencing some anxiety is normal, but if it’s so strong that it interferes with you being able to carry out your normal day-to-day life, it may be an [anxiety disorder.](https://healthify.nz/health-a-z/a/anxiety)
####    
Need help now?
If you’re feeling like you need to talk to somebody now you can free call (0800 376 633) or text (234) [Youthline(external link)](https://youthline.co.nz/ "Open external link"), or the [What’s Up(external link)](http://www.whatsup.co.nz/ "Open external link") line (0800 942 8787), for 5 to 18 year olds.
####  What is the cycle of anxiety? 
When you feel anxious about some potential threat, you start paying attention to possible causes of danger and your anxiety symptoms.
